item.title: Dumped kitchen shelves, cupboard panels and metal frames have been left on the ground next to the communal bins on Webb Road, SE3 7PL. They’ve been there for several weeks and are blocking access to the bins., 11th November
item.description:
These kitchen shelves and other household items have been dumped by the communal bins on Webb Road, SE3 7PL. They’ve been here for several weeks and are creating an eyesore, blocking part of the pavement and attracting rubbish around them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Webb Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement slab very raised, 11th November
item.description:
The pavement slab is raised and a trip hazard, there are no streetlights and it is often covered in leaves from the nearby tree leaving it difficult to see.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Victoria Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Lots of leaves creating slip hazards on the pavement, 11th November
item.description:
Lots of leafs on pavements on both sides of Plough Way again, which will need clearing given the high number of pedestrians and the associated increased likelihood of slip hazards in wet weather.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plough Way, Rotherhithe, London

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, East Wickham, London

item.title: Bushes so tall, prime location to rape a woman, 11th November
item.description:
To walk to Falconwood station from where I live and walk home, I have to walk on the pathway down the side of Eltham Cemetery and the A2 slip road (between Riefield road to Crown Wood way). However, the vegetation and bushes have been allowed to get so tall, this long path is now completely hidden from view, so is immensely dark (particularly as one lamppost has been chopped off so no light) and has the high cemetery wall on the other side. It has been made to feel and look like a long alleyway. For a woman walking on her own down this path from 5pm at night and 6am in the morning (when this is the only way to get to Station from Orchard Wise West because on the other side of the A2 to get to Falconwood station you have to go down a hidden alleyway from A2 path to Wincroft Avenue), its now terrifying as you fear being attacked or raped. This needs to be rectified now, and the vegetation cut down to waist height so that people can see the cars on the slip road and be completely seen to everyone, reducing any chance of being raped. To say this work needs to wait for next scheduled work is completely unacceptable due to the huge risk of attack and rape. Teenagers also use this slip road, as well as people walking to Eltham Cemetery. You can be attacked down this slip road even in daylight.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Rochester Way, Avery Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture dumped in front of electric cupboard, 11th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61-66, Wilmot Close, Peckham, London
